text: My Love is a song of the Irish boy band Westlife. It is released on October 30, 2000 as the second single from their second studio album Coast to Coast. ==Release== My Love debuted at number one on the UK Singles Chart. The song was the 35th best-selling single of 2000 in the United Kingdom (UK), winning them The Record of the Year. ==Tracklist== UK CD1 # "My Love" (radio edit) # "If I Let You Go" (USA mix) # Enhanced section UK CD2 # "My Love" (radio edit) # "My Love" (instrumental) # Enhanced section UK cassette single and European CD single # "My Love" (radio edit) # "If I Let You Go" (USA mix) Australian CD single # "My Love" (radio edit) # "If I Let You Go" (USA mix) # "My Love" (instrumental) # Enhanced section ==Credits and personnel== Credits are adapted from the UK CD1 liner notes. Recording * Vocal recorded at the Cheiron Studios, Stockholm, Sweden * Orchestra recorded at the Roam Studios, Stockholm, Sweden Personnel * Per Magnusson – songwriting, production, arrangement, keyboards, programming * David Kreuger – songwriting, production, arrangement, programming * Jörgen Elofsson – songwriting * Pelle Nylén – songwriting * Ulf and Erik Jansson – arrangement and Stockholm Session Orchestra conducting * Björn Norén – orchestra recording * Bernard Löhr – mixing * Esbjörn Öhrwall – acoustic and electric guitars * Thomas Lindberg – bass * Gustave Lund – percussion * Åke Sundqvist – percussion * Joakim Agnas – piccolo trumpet * Anders von Hofsten – additional backing vocals * Björn Engelmann – mastering ==Performance== The song sold 400,000 copies in the UK between October 30, 2000 and October 10, 2010. By January 2019, the song had become Westlife's fifth most-streamed single in the UK. Two years later, the song became the band's most popular single on YouTube. As of January 29, 2025, the song's original MV has accumulated 378,362,110 views. ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== Charts (2000 – 2001) Peak position Croatia (Croatian Radiotelevision) 3 Denmark (IFPI Danmark) 6 Europe (Eurochart Hot 100) 3 Europe (European Hit Radio) 14 Iceland (Íslenski Listinn Topp 40) 2 Poland (Polish Airplay Charts) 4 ===Year-end charts=== Chart (2000) Position Ireland (IRMA) 13 Netherlands (Single Top 100) 100 Sweden (Sverigetopplistan) 28 UK Singles (OCC) 35 Chart (2001) Position Europe (European Hit Radio) 85 New Zealand (Recorded Music NZ) 43 ===Sales=== ==References== Category:Pop songs Category:Irish culture Category:2000 songs Category:British culture Category:2000s ballads Category:Westlife songs Category:2000s in the United Kingdom
title: My Love
